message:
Does anybody know companies here in Cairo which has products built upon a good model of Microservices architecture and are concerned with event buses, docker, build and deployment automation, Cloud-Based (AWS or GCP), unit and automated integration tests, multi tenancy?

Please if you know any state company names, product/business domain and technology stack they use.

Thanks in advance

data.message:
I can say that orange labs were working on very nice projects related also to CQRS and Event Sourcing and Microservices
Stack was Scala, Java, Akka Http, Akka Persistence, Cassandra, Jenkins, Docker, Grafana, Kibana, Elasticsearch, Logstash, Android, AngulrJS 1.5 , Cukes Cucumber and more :-)
I think Eventtus does. They mentioned something like that in there medium https://medium.com/eventtus-technical-blog

At Instabug  we do have a good microservices architecture, we manage our entire infrastructure over AWS cloud using mesos, marathon, zookeeper, kafka ... etc through DC/OS ... we use prometheus + grafana for monitoring and ELK + logspout for logging 
We use vamp for blue green deployments, canary releases and SLA ... 
Our testing pipeline is relatively great too
Our stack includes ROR, mysql, elasticsearch, redis, go, nodejs

Products are not built on a MicroServices Architecture, but software services, and Enterprise services can be. Considering the fact that the enterprises in Egypt are rather primitive, I would not expect that, perhaps a mutinational.

We have incredible technology stack (we are even competing against aws, azure!) also we got our own alternative to docker `we use docker extensively anyways`

tags of what we use: go, python, dockers, libvirt, grafana, influxdb, .....

At OUSTA - أسطى, our system is event driven, Microservices based architecture that consists of about 15 services distributed around business functionalities,our stack includes php,postgresql,postgis & elasticsearch,we also use jenkins for continuous integration , elaaticbeanstalk for continuous deployment, AWS cloud watch for infrastructure monitoring, rollbar for application level monitoring, AWS SNS as a publish subscribe service & AWS SQS as a message queueing service.
